de.boereck.matcher.helpers

Class IntMatchHelpers

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.boereck.matcher.helpers.IntMatchHelpers

  • public final class IntMatchHelpers
extends Object
    This class provides static methods and final fields holding references to methods that can be used as predicates in case definitions of matchers for int values. This class is not intended to be instantiated or sub-classed.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static AdvIntPredicate even
      Holds a predicate checking if an int value is even (dividable by 2).
      static AdvIntPredicate negative
      Holds a predicate checking if an int value is negative.
      static AdvIntPredicate odd
      Holds a predicate checking if an int value is odd (not dividable by 2).
      static AdvIntPredicate positive
      Holds a predicate checking if an int value is positive.

                          throws NullPointerException
        Returns a predicate that checks if an int value is greater than the value provided by compareWith.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        predicate checking if an int value is greater than the value provided by compareWith.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - will be thrown if compareWith is null

      • oneOf

        public static AdvIntPredicate oneOf(int el,
                                    int... more)
                             throws NullPointerException
        Returns predicate that returns true if the input int is one of the given integers el or more.
        Parameters:
        el - one element predicate will check if input is equal to it
        more - further elements the predicate will check if element is one of them.
        Returns:
        predicate checking if the input int is either el or one of more.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - is thrown if more is null.

      • dividableBy

        public static AdvIntPredicate dividableBy(int divisor)
        Returns a predicate checking if an int value is dividable by divisor without leaving a rest.
        Parameters:
        divisor - int value that is used in the returned predicate to check if a value is dividable by this value without leaving a rest.
        Returns:
        predicate checking if an input int value is dividable by divisor without leaving a rest.

      • notDividableBy

        public static AdvIntPredicate notDividableBy(int divisor)
        Returns a predicate checking if an int value is not dividable by divisor. Meaning an integer division leaves a rest.
        Parameters:
        divisor - int value that is used in the returned predicate to check if a value is not dividable by this value (integer division leaves a rest).
        Returns:
        predicate checking if an input int value is not dividable by divisor (integer division leaves a rest).

      • dividableBy

        public static AdvIntPredicate dividableBy(IntSupplier divisor)
                                   throws NullPointerException
        Returns a predicate checking if an int value is dividable by the value provided by divisor without leaving a rest.
        Parameters:
        divisor - is used in the returned predicate to check if a value is dividable by the value provided by divisor without leaving a rest. This parameter must not be null.
        Returns:
        predicate checking if an input int value is not dividable by divisor (integer division leaves a rest).
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - will be thrown if divisor is null

      • notDividableBy

        public static AdvIntPredicate notDividableBy(IntSupplier divisor)
                                      throws NullPointerException
        Returns a predicate checking if an int value is not dividable by the value provided by divisor. Meaning an integer division leaves a rest.
        Parameters:
        divisor - is used in the returned predicate to check if a value is not dividable by the value provided by divisor (integer division leaves a rest). This parameter must not be null.
        Returns:
        predicate checking if an input int value is not dividable by the value provided by divisor (integer division leaves a rest).
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - will be thrown if divisor is null

      • selectInt

        public static IntFunction<OptionalInt> selectInt(IntPredicate test)
                                          throws NullPointerException
        This method returns a function takes and int and that based on predicate test returns an optional containing the input int (if test returned true) or an empty optional (if test returned false).
        Parameters:
        test - determines if the returned function returns an optional containing the input int or an empty optional. This parameter must not be null.
        Returns:
        A function that takes an int and returns an optional holding the input int, if predicate test returned true for the input int, or an empty optional if test returned false for the input int.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - will be thrown if test is null

      • filterInt

        public static IntFunction<OptionalInt> filterInt(IntFunction<OptionalInt> orig,
                                                 IntPredicate p)
                                          throws NullPointerException
        This method returns a function that filters the output of a given function mapping an int to an OptionalInt. This means that based on the predicate p will be used to test the output of orig. If the output OptionalInt does not contain a value, the result will be this optional. If the result does contain an int value, it will be tested with p, if the predicate returns false, an empty optional will be returned, otherwise the optional holding the value will be returned.
        Parameters:
        orig - function mapping an int to an OptionalInt. The result of this function will be filtered. Must not be null.
        p - used to filter the output of orig. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        A function taking an int, calls orig with the int, filters the returned output using p and returns the result of this filtering.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - will be thrown if orig or p is null

      • compose

        public static IntFunction<OptionalInt> compose(IntFunction<OptionalInt> f,
                                               IntUnaryOperator toApply)
                                        throws NullPointerException
        Returns f function mapping from int to OptionalInt. The returned function will take the input int and use function f on this. If the resulting optional is empty, it will be returned. If the resulting optional is not empty, operation toApply will be called in the int in the returned optional and the result will be wrapped into an OptionalInt and returned.
        Parameters:
        f - function, that will be composed with operator toApply. Must not be null.
        toApply - operator that will be used on the output of function f, if the optional holds a result. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        function combining function f with operation toApply on the result of f, if the result is a non-empty Optional.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - will be thrown if f or toApply is null

      • inClosedRange

        public static AdvIntPredicate inClosedRange(int startIncluding,
                                            int endIncluding)
                                     throws IllegalArgumentException
        Returns a predicate that checks if an input int is in the closed range from startIncluding to endIncluding.
        Parameters:
        startIncluding - start value. Input may be greater or equal to this.
        endIncluding - end value. Input may be lower or equal to this.
        Returns:
        predicate checking if an input value is in the closed range from startIncluding to endIncluding.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if startIncluding > endIncluding.

      • allExcept

        public static AdvIntPredicate allExcept(int excluding,
                                        int... excludingMore)
                                 throws NullPointerException
        Returns a predicate that checks if a given int value is not on a black list of integer values, defined by parameters excluding and excludingMore.
        Parameters:
        excluding - if input value to returned predicate equals this value, the predicate will return false
        excludingMore - excluding if input value to returned predicate equals any of this int values, the predicate will return false. This parameter must not be null, but may be an empty array.
        Returns:
        Predicate that returns false if the input value equals excluding or values in excludingMore, otherwise it returns true.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if excludingMore is null.
